subtopics.title: Importance of the French Revolution
subtopics.description: The French Revolution was more important than other revolutions of its time due to France's size, power, and influence in Europe.

subtopics.title: Social Revolution
subtopics.description: Various social groups, including women, sans-culottes, peasants, and the bourgeoisie, participated in the revolution with the shared goal of freedom.

subtopics.title: Radical Nature
subtopics.description: The revolution was radical, evidenced by the execution of the royal family and approximately 50,000 people.

subtopics.title: Universal Revolution
subtopics.description: The ideas of the French Revolution spread throughout Europe, America, and Asia.

subtopics.title: Stages of the French Revolution
subtopics.description: The classic stages include the First French Republic and the Napoleonic stage.
